basic.description:
An introduction to numerical methods as used in economics, finance, and related fields. Topics include optimization, non-linear systems, numerical approximation, and simulation. Includes a major project where students implement economic models or replicate work found in the literature.
NOTE    Programming experience is recommended but not required. Students with a strong math or computing background can contact the department for permission.
LEARNING HOURS    120 (36L;18G;66P)
basic.subject: ECON
basic.title: Computational Methods in Economics and Finance

extra.enrollment_requirement:
Prerequisite       ECON255
Corequisite      ECON250 or STAT263
